p: These analyses also indicated that A1 was already present in East Africa by 1960 and in West Africa by 1975. In addition, the MRCAs of A-attributed fragments of CRF04_cpx, CRF19_cpx, CRF06_cpx, and CRF09_cpx were already circulating outside the CB before the 1980s ( TableÂ 1). The fact that there are so many detectable long-distance movements of A1 and A1-derived recombinants prior to the 1980s is certainly consistent with A1 viruses being predisposed to starting new epidemics.
